channel.title: Posts on 张 瀚 铎 Zhang Handuo
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on 张 瀚 铎 Zhang Handuo

item.title: CLion for catkin projects
item.description: Why use CLion? Better indexing and intelligence hints for C++ than Eclipse and QtCreator-desktop. Free for students. Also integrate PyCharm already. Good Git integration (although I am still used to commandline git). I really like the code inspection clang-tidy function which makes the code style more modern. Initial set-up Highly recommend you to add source <CATKIN_WORKSPACE_DIR>/devel/setup.bash to the end of ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc (Depends you use bash or zsh).

item.title: Pooling Layer in CNN (1)
item.description: Today I didn’t have the mood to continue my work on map merging of different cameras. So I read the paper from DeepMind of Learned Deformation Stability in Convolutional Neural Networks recommended by Wang Chen. 1. Convolution Operation Convolution operation is typically denoted with an asterisk1: $$ s(t)=(x*w)(t) $$ In Convolutional network terminology, the x is referred to as the input, and the w as the kernel. The output is sometimes referred to as the feature map.
